intro: Fagara tomentella, commonly known as the woolly fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
